data.title: Who Are The New King & Queen of Denmark?
data.meta_description: As Crown Prince Frederik and Crown Princess Mary take to the Danish throne, Tatler looks a little deeper into the new King and Queen of Denmark. Their accession comes just 2 weeks after Queen Margrethe II announced her abdication during her annual New Year's Eve speech. Find out why the royal pair's approval rating are through the roof, as Denmark enters the era of Frederik X.
data.text:
Today, Crown Prince Frederik and Crown Princess Mary

officially become King and Queen of Denmark.

Their accession comes two weeks

after Queen Margrethe II announced her abdication

in a shock turn during her annual New Year's Eve speech.

In keeping with Danish tradition

since the introduction of the Constitution in 1849,

the Prime Minister will appear

on the balcony of Christiansborg Palace,

officially announce the abdication of the Queen,

and declare, Long lived the new King.

And with that, Denmark enters the era of Frederik the 10th.

It couldn't have come at a better time.

Frederik and Mary's approval ratings are currently

at 84 and 85% respectively.

They have increased their number

of official engagements in recent years,

and the sense among Danes is that they are ready.

Frederik met his now wife,

the Scottish Australian Mary Donaldson,

at the Slip Inn in Sydney during the 2000 Olympics,

and after an initially secret romance,

they married four years later at the Copenhagen Cathedral.

They have four children, the eldest, Prince Christian,

celebrated his 18th birthday this year at the palace.

Mary's such a hit,

the Australian and British newspapers

were at war over her nationality.

Her parents are from East Lothian,

but moved to Tasmania before she was born.

Even so, the official coat of arms created for her

references Scotland and the MacDonald clan

from which she hails.

Mary has put a tremendous amount of work

into becoming Danish.

She's traveled widely, learned the language to a high level,

and become the glamorous, most prominent face

of the royal family.

The result, she is the nation's highest polling royal,

even above Margrethe.

No wonder she's said to have inspired the Princess of Wales.

Together, the new king and queen

have also weathered scandal.

An affair allegation sprung up late last year

after Frederik was spotted on a night out

with the Mexican socialite, Genoveva Casanova.

But the story never took off in Denmark

like it has in the global press.

Casanova has separately denied the rumors,

branding them malicious.

Insiders say Frederik and Mary have a winning formula.

Mary naturally excels when handed responsibility.

Frederik has a relaxed, charismatic style

that looks set for success.

Peter Thygesen, the Senior Editor

at Denmark's leading broadsheet, Politiken,

says they have big shoes to fill.

Margrethe II is already a legacy with immense respect,

and they will only earn and retain the same by hard work.
